metadata.title: CVE-2021-20179 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - high
metadata.description: A flaw was found in pki-core. An attacker who has successfully compromiseda key could use this flaw to renew the corresponding certificate over andover again, as long as it is not explicitly revoked. The highest threatfrom this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity.

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
